§ 301. Federal recognition of enlisted members To be eligible for Federal recognition as an enlisted member of the National Guard, a person must have the qualifications prescribed by the Secretary concerned for the grade, branch, position, and type of unit or organization involved. He becomes federally recognized upon enlisting in a federally recognized unit or organization of the National Guard. (Aug. 10, 1956, ch. 1041, 70A Stat. 601.)
